items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
Proposed new board policy (BP) 3440 concerning the use of service animals for accessing facilities and participating in the District’s services and programs was presented for first reading at the March 4, 2013, meeting and is now presented for adoption. The language for the legally-required policy was recommended by legal counsel and further refined after review by the Chancellor's Cabinet and Chancellor's Advisory Council. 
	 
On January 25, 2013, the Chancellor's Advisory Council approved the new board policy and the associated administrative procedure, which is included for information. 
	 
Submitted by:
Linda Thor, extension 6104
Additional contact names:
Dorene Novotny, extension 6211
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Chancellor Thor recommends adoption of new Board Policy 3440 Service Animals.
items.item_text: Board Policy 3440 Service Animals - New (2nd Reading)
items.item_text_raw: 1. Board Policy 3440 Service Animals - New (2nd Reading)

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
At the March 4, 2013, meeting, new board policy (BP) 3500 Alcohol On Campus was presented for first review, and it is now presented for adoption. The new policy is recommended in order for the District to invoke a recent change in the law (Business & Professions Code section 25608) that provides for special events (section 25608 {a} (15)) to be included in the exceptions to the legal prohibition of alcoholic beverages on district property. The attached executive summary of the change in the law details the rationale for adoption of the new policy.
	 
District administrative procedures (AP) 3500 and 3501 have been revised to allow for the special events exemption in addition to the previously allowed exceptions for Foundation sponsored fundraising events (Section 25608{a}(10)) and for certain events at the Flint Center which are not sponsored by the College District and held while the Flint Center is under lease to a private, non-profit corporation (section 25608{a}(5)). The approved administrative procedures are included for clarification.
	 
Legal counsel vetted the new policy and revised procedures, and the Chancellor’s Advisory Council reviewed and approved both the changes to the administrative procedures and the new policy on January 25, 2013.
	 
Submitted by:
Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, extension 6201
Additional contact names:
					 
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Vice Chancellor McElroy recommends adoption of new board policy 3500 Alcohol on Campus.
items.item_text: Board Policy 3500 Alcohol On Campus - New (2nd Reading)
items.item_text_raw: 2. Board Policy 3500 Alcohol On Campus - New (2nd Reading)

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
Presented for second reading are revisions to board policies related to disclosure of student records. The revisions, which were presented for first reading at the March 4, 2013, meeting have been recommended to bring the district in line with federal and state regulations. The name of board policy (BP) 5050 has been changed from “Furnishing Information Concerning Students” to “Disclosure of Student Records,” and board policies 5045 Student Information and Educational Records and 5048 Furnishing Directory Information have been merged into the revised policy.  
	 
The Chancellor's Advisory Council approved the policy changes on January 25, 2013. Also approved were procedural changes, attached for clarification, that changed the name of “AP 5045 The Family Educational Right and Privacy Act” to “AP 5050 Disclosure of Student Records” and altered sections of AP 3260 Electronic Information Security. 
	 
Submitted by:
Linda Thor, extension 6104
Additional contact names:
Joseph Moreau, Andrew LaManque
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Chancellor Thor recommends approval of revisions to board policy 5050 Disclosure of Student Records and revocation of board policies 5045 Student Information and Educational Records and 5048 Furnishing Directory Information.
items.item_text: Board Policy 5050 Furnishing Information Concerning Students - Revised (2nd Reading)
items.item_text_raw: 3. Board Policy 5050 Furnishing Information Concerning Students - Revised (2nd Reading)

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
At the March 4, 2013, meeting a revised prerequisite/corequisite board policy was presented for first reading and it is now presented for adoption. The revisions bring the policy into alignment with current requirements and separate processes included in the policy into a new administrative procedure. 
	 
The revised policy and new procedure were approved by the Academic and Professional Matters Committee on November 6, 2012; De Anza College Academic Senate on November 26, 2013; Foothill College Academic Senate on January 28, 2013; and the Chancellor's Advisory Council on February 22, 2013.
	 
Submitted by:
Linda Thor, extension 6104
Additional contact names:
Carolyn Holcroft, extension 7429
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Chancellor Thor recommends approval of revised board policy 6060 Prerequisites/Corequisites.

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
Foothill seeks board approval for new Stand Alone Courses for the 2013-14 Catalog.  Per Title 5 direction, every course that is not part of a State approved degree or certificate or is not part of the Foothill General Education Requirements is required to have completed an application to substantiate its appropriateness to our mission, prove that it has met Foothill’s curriculum standards and that it is compliant with regard to enrollment restrictions and accreditation standards.
	 
These courses have completed College Curriculum Committee applications and have been approved through the established Foothill curriculum process.
	 
Submitted by:
 Judy Miner
Additional contact names:
 Kimberlee Messina, Carolyn Holcroft
Is backup provided?
 Yes
items.item_recommendation: Foothill administration recommends approval of these Stand Alone Courses.
items.item_text: Foothill - Approval of Stand Alone Courses
items.item_text_raw: 7. Foothill - Approval of Stand Alone Courses

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
Foothill seeks board approval for curriculum changes for the 2013-14 Catalog.  Per Title 5 direction, all course changes, substantial and non-substantial, must be approved by the governing board of the District before they may be submitted to the State Chancellor's Office for final approval.
	 
These courses have met Foothill’s curriculum standards and the Foothill College Curriculum Committee certifies that they are compliant with Title 5 regulations.
	 
Submitted by:
 Judy Miner
Additional contact names:
 Kimberlee Messina, Carolyn Holcroft
Is backup provided?
 Yes
items.item_recommendation: Foothill administration recommends approval of these changes.
items.item_text: Foothill - Approval of Curriculum Updates for 2013-14 Catalog

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
In accordance with Education Code 87469, probationer faculty employees must serve at least 75% of the hours/days considered a full-time assignment for the year to be counted as a year of service as probationary employees.  Further, in accordance with Education Code 87776 time spent on any unpaid leave of absence shall not be included in computing the service required as a prerequisite to attainment of, or eligibility for, tenure.
	 
The following probationer faculty employee shall be reemployed as follows:
	 
Phase I 2012-2013 to Phase I 2013-2014
	 
De Anza College:
Debra Dobosz
	 
*Advancement in the tenure process is contingent upon having met all requirements including having served a complete probationary contract year. A probationary faculty employee is deemed to have completed a probationary contract year if he or she provides service for 75 percent of the academic year. If the probationary faculty employee serves less than 75 percent of an academic year, the year shall be considered a "prob zero" year and shall not count for tenure.  In such cases the tenure process is interrupted by the prob zero year and shall be resumed in the subsequent academic year in which the faculty employee is able to perform services for 75 percent of the academic year.
	 
Submitted by:
Dorene Novotny, Vice Chancellor of Human Resources & Equal Opportunity, ext. 6211
Additional contact names:
					 
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Dorene Novotny, Vice Chancellor of Human Resources and Equal Opportunity, recommends approval.

items.item_details:
The Purpose of a VTA Eco Pass agreement is to provide annual transit passes which will be distributed by Foothill De Anza Community College District to all eligible students of Foothill College. 
	 
At the Foothill Student Body election January 28 – 31, 2013, a majority of students (1112 out of 1333 students voting) agreed that the Foothill De Anza Community College District Board of Trustees should 
take action to charge a mandatory quarterly fee of up to five dollars to all full-time Foothill College students and a mandatory quarterly prorated fee to all Foothill College part-time students to make a VTA 
Eco Pass available to all students.
Education Code Section 76361(b)(2) authorizes the governing board of a community college district to charge a mandatory transportation fee to all students upon the favorable vote of a majority of the students 
of a campus who voted at the election.
The college is requesting the approval of a Board resolution implementing the mandatory transportation fee effective Fall quarter 2013 for a period of two years. 
	 
Submitted by:
 Judy Miner
Additional contact names:
 
Is backup provided?
 Yes
items.item_recommendation: Foothill administration recommends approval of the resolution for a mandatory transportation fee.
items.item_text: Foothill-Resolution Authorizing Assessment of a Mandatory Transportation Fee to Foothill College Students for the VTA Eco-Pass Program (ACTION)

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
Student trustee Vincent Mendoza was unable to attend the regular Board of Trustees meeting of March 4, 2013, due to participation in the March in March and the Faculty Association of California Community Colleges Conference in Sacramento, California.  As stated in Education Code §72024(d):
	 
A member may be paid for any meeting when absent if the board, by resolution duly adopted and included in its minutes, finds that, at the time of the meeting, he or she is performing services outside the meeting for the community college district, he or she was ill or on jury duty, or the absence was due to a hardship deemed acceptable by the board. The compensation shall be a charge against the funds of the district.
	 
Included for adoption by the Board is a resolution verifying the circumstances of student trustee Mendoza’s absence as required by Education Code Section 72024(d).
	 
Submitted by:
Linda Thor, Chancellor, extension 6104
Additional contact names:
					 
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Chancellor Linda Thor recommends that the Board of Trustees adopt the resolution pursuant to Education Code Section 72024(d).
items.item_text: Resolution Authorizing Trustee Absence for Vincent Mendoza (ACTION)
items.item_text_raw: 19. Resolution Authorizing Trustee Absence for Vincent Mendoza (ACTION)
